definitions.definition: to stop something from being done or used especially by law
definitions.sensetop: prohibit somethingprohibit somebody from doing somethingprohibit (somebody) doing something

examples.text: Federal law prohibits discrimination based on age.
Soviet citizens were prohibited from travelling abroad.
Company policy prohibits posting clearly abusive content.
The import of these products is prohibited by law.
The regulations effectively prohibit the entry of seeds into the country.
The convention strictly prohibits the dumping of waste at sea.
The Act specifically prohibits any council from spending money for political purposes.
The president is constitutionally prohibited from serving more than two terms in office.

definitions.definition: to make something impossible to do

examples.text: The high cost of equipment prohibits many people from taking up this sport.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin prohibit- ‘kept in check’, from the verb prohibere, from pro- ‘in front’ + habere ‘to hold’.
